title: is this calculator ok for college or do i need a better one?

comments.body: Get FX-991 EX

No,Get either of these 3
Fx-991CW
Fx-991EX
Fx-991ES

This is exactly what I had, unfortunately it can't do scientific calc.. so its better you shift to FX-991   
u/broke-my-feet has mentioned the models.. any one is fine
This is shit you can't do matrix operation and so on....go for fx 991es

991 ex is the best

U get to perform calculations of degree 4 and even vectors of higher dimensions compared to the other ones
And Fx-991ES plus
This calci Is enough u don't need another one
what about the 100ms one??
alright thanks!
thank you!
oh i see okayy
Any calculator which can solve matrices and solve equations works
Do I need to buy one in 1st year??
What is the need?? Is it allowed in exams??
Yep
Yes

But what if I already have this one?
Statistics student here
You can still do most types of calculations but not all so it's not a compulsion to buy this model in specific.
I second this. I had the same one too and it's missing some real important stuff like solving definite integrals and doing cubic question. Not gonna lie, it has cost me a few marks.
Yes.. this will do.. anything non programmable will do
But that was OG.. a really good one!
Can't deny.
lol, bro is stuck in school.
What do you expect from a person who is studying in school for the past 14 yrs??
to be aware of how things work ahead.

PLEASE DO NOT GET THESE DOUBLE LINE ONES, you'll have a hard time in matrix questions+in this you probably can't even solve them

Get the Casio textbook display ones (fx991 ex plus)

Or what I would recommend you is to get the fx991 cw (i personally bought it after struggling with my 2 line calculator)
Yes it is a bit more expensive, but its worth it
Faster+less chance of errors because you can see the exact values you have entered
got it thanks!
Get 991 cw, had this trash in first sem, can't do basic stuff like integration or summation
You can try to get the graphic one. But this is the basic one required for the exams. It depends on the branch and teachers input.
